author: dapplion
content: There are only a couple nitpicks left on the PR that may be faster to discuss on real time chat:

author: dapplion
content:
<@415109946682769408> brings up a concern over this function's computational complexity

```python
def is_k_commitment_unique(state: BeaconState, k_commitment: BLSG1Point) -> bool:
    return all([validator.whisk_k_commitment != k_commitment for validator in state.validators])
```

However yes on a deposit this requires a full loop over the validator list. But a naive implementation of the beacon chain already requires that to check if the pubkey of a deposit has been seen before or not. This addition will require clients to mantain cached set of k_commitment to avoid that loop if they choose. AFAIK spec should not be concerned with computational efficiency but correctness, and the current whisk spec new k_commitment to be unique.

author: dapplion
content: <@862973562243252234>  original whisk spec PR prefixed everything with `whisk_`, makes it clear which properties are related to the feature but looks verbose compared to the rest of the spec. I would vote to remove the `whisk_` prefix from everything, any objections?
